text: Something wrong with output from list in Python
I want a Python program to import a list of words from a text file and print out the content of the text file as two lists.
The data in the text file is on this form:

code:
A Alfa
B Betta
C Charlie

text: I want a Python program to print out one list with A,B,C and one with Alfa, Betta, Charlie.

code:
english2german = open('english2german.txt', 'r')
englist = []
gerlist = []

for i, line in enumerate(english2german):
    englist[i:], gerlist[i:] = line.split()

text: This is making two lists, but will only print out the first letter in each word.
How can I make my code to print out the whole word?
